intro: Calyptranthes sessilis, commonly known as the sessile calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known plants like eucalyptus and guava. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds.
